title: Bug: foundry fails building due to mismatched types
body:
### Component

Other (please describe)

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [ ] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

_No response_

### What command(s) is the bug in?

cargo build --bins --release

### Operating System

_No response_

### Describe the bug

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:95:21
   |
95 |     runtime.command(cmd.clone());
   |                     ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`, found struct `Vec`
   |
   = note: expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`
            found struct `Vec<std::string::String>`

error[E0061]: this function takes 2 arguments but 1 argument was supplied
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:101:8
    |
101 |     wx.send_event(Event::default()).await?;
    |        ^^^^^^^^^^ ---------------- supplied 1 argument
    |        |
    |        expected 2 arguments
    |
note: associated function defined here
   --> /opt/foundry/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/watchexec-2.0.0/src/watchexec.rs:156:15
    |
156 |     pub async fn send_event(&self, event: Event, priority: Priority) -> Result<(), CriticalError> {
    |                  ^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:114:21
    |
114 |     runtime.command(cmd.clone());
    |                     ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`, found struct `Vec`
    |
    = note: expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`
             found struct `Vec<std::string::String>`

error[E0061]: this function takes 2 arguments but 1 argument was supplied
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:120:8
    |
120 |     wx.send_event(Event::default()).await?;
    |        ^^^^^^^^^^ ---------------- supplied 1 argument
    |        |
    |        expected 2 arguments
    |
note: associated function defined here
   --> /opt/foundry/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/watchexec-2.0.0/src/watchexec.rs:156:15
    |
156 |     pub async fn send_event(&self, event: Event, priority: Priority) -> Result<(), CriticalError> {
    |                  ^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:132:21
    |
132 |     runtime.command(cmd.clone());
    |                     ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`, found struct `Vec`
    |
    = note: expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`
             found struct `Vec<std::string::String>`

error[E0061]: this function takes 2 arguments but 1 argument was supplied
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:154:8
    |
154 |     wx.send_event(Event::default()).await?;
    |        ^^^^^^^^^^ ---------------- supplied 1 argument
    |        |
    |        expected 2 arguments
    |
note: associated function defined here
   --> /opt/foundry/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/watchexec-2.0.0/src/watchexec.rs:156:15
    |
156 |     pub async fn send_event(&self, event: Event, priority: Priority) -> Result<(), CriticalError> {
    |                  ^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:206:24
    |
206 |         config.command(cmd.clone());
    |                        ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`, found struct `Vec`
    |
    = note: expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`
             found struct `Vec<std::string::String>`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:245:20
    |
245 |     config.command(new_cmd);
    |                    ^^^^^^^ expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`, found struct `Vec`
    |
    = note: expected enum `watchexec::command::Command`
             found struct `Vec<std::string::String>`

error[E0599]: no method named `command_shell` found for struct `RuntimeConfig` in the current scope
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:396:12
    |
396 |     config.command_shell(default_shell());
    |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ method not found in `RuntimeConfig`

error[E0599]: no variant or associated item named `default` found for enum `watchexec::command::Shell` in the current scope
   --> cli/src/cmd/forge/watch.rs:419:12
    |
419 |     Shell::default()
    |            ^^^^^^^ variant or associated item not found in `watchexec::command::Shell`

Some errors have detailed explanations: E0061, E0308, E0599.
For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0061`.
error: could not compile `foundry-cli` due to 10 previous errors
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

running `cargo build --bins --release`  

using rustc 1.59,
debian bullseye

here are some additional issues:

https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-rs/runs/6964944625?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:939
https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-rs/runs/6962779574?check_suite_focus=true#step:6:1791


```log
    Checking ethers-contract v0.6.2 (https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs#c7a8a1ea)
error: this match could be replaced by its scrutinee and body
    --> config/src/lib.rs:3077:13
     |
3077 | /             match fs::create_dir(metadata_path.as_path()) {
3078 | |                 _ => {}
3079 | |             }
     | |_____________^
     |
     = note: `-D clippy::match-single-binding` implied by `-D warnings`
     = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#match_single_binding
help: consider using the scrutinee and body instead
     |
3077 ~             fs::create_dir(metadata_path.as_path());
3078 +             {}
     |
error: this match could be replaced by its scrutinee and body
    --> config/src/lib.rs:3080:13
     |
3080 | /             match fs::create_dir(abi_path.as_path()) {
3081 | |                 _ => {}
3082 | |             }
     | |_____________^
     |
     = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#match_single_binding
help: consider using the scrutinee and body instead
     |
3080 ~             fs::create_dir(abi_path.as_path());
3081 +             {}
     |
```

I had to clone and mirror foundry repo to be able to enable debug output for github actions. you can see the latest test running is almost done https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-rs/runs/6964944415?check_suite_focus=true
